tool_description:
API for fetching Hackaday Posts, the DB is updated as soon as a post is posted on Hackaday website or within +-10 mins.
http://hackaday.com
name: Hackaday Distribution Network.
title: Hackaday Distribution Network.

api_list.name: Get Front Page Posts
api_list.description: Fetch Posts that are displayed on http://hackaday.com front page. (changes regularly)
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://pareshchouhan-hackaday-distribution-network-v1.p.rapidapi.com/getFrontPagePosts"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "pareshchouhan-hackaday-distribution-network-v1.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
api_list.convert_code:
import requests

url = "https://pareshchouhan-hackaday-distribution-network-v1.p.rapidapi.com/getFrontPagePosts"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "pareshchouhan-hackaday-distribution-network-v1.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

api_list.name: Get Posts
api_list.description: Get Posts Sorted in Descending Date order.

optional_parameters.name: limit
optional_parameters.description: Number of articles to fetch at a time. maths is quite simple page = 2 and limit = 10 will fetch , 11 - 20 articles (articles sorted in descending date order)
